channel.title: Shard Revolutions - Winterlove base, High Performance , Great starting base
channel.description:
You will have issues if you use this with JDK 6 update 10. Please try with a more stable version instead, such as update 3 or update 7.
ALPHA 8 WITH TRADING RELEASED!
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/alpha8.rar
Enjoy!
If anyone knows the player 3/4 line dialogue sword hide/show packets, please contact me. I would like to know them, if you can find them for me, you will receive full credits! Thank you all!
[img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/logo.php[/img] Thanks epiphone and rsc for the logos! (it should automatically give you a random one)
This is a project that myself and Ventrillo are working on (Jonas++ has submitted quite a lot as well, and rsc designed the website). Btw, this is open source if you can't figure out from the post.
NEWS: Alpha 7 released
Incldues a server GUI and many bugfixes.
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha7.rar
NEWS: Alpha 6c released
Alpha 6c includes some (more) crucial bugfixes related to the stability of the server, you should all upgrade.
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha6c.rar
NEWS: Alpha 6b released
Alpha 6b includes some crucial bugfixes related to the stability of the server, you should all upgrade.
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha6b.rar
NEWS: Alpha 6 released, includes shops and bonus code!
You can get it here:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha6.rar
NEWS: Alpha 5 released, includes PVNPC melee combat!
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha5.rar
NEWS: Alpha 4 released
Alpha 4 is a bugfix release and includes fixes to many synchronization issues. You can download it here: http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha4.rar
NEWS: Alpha 3C released, with Jonas's fletching!
Download at http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha3c.rar
NEWS: Alpha 3B released!
This includes numerous bug fixes and the mining rocks now become gray after being mined.
Download at http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha3b.rar
NEWS: Website created
The address is http://shardrev.grahamedgecombe.com/.
NEWS: Alpha 3A released!
This includes the long awaited object manager!, many bugfixes, dialogue improvements and woodcutting stumps (as a demo for the object manager)!
Quick teleport bugfix:
Inside Magic.java find
[code]player.actionAssistant.startAnimation(-1);[/code]
Under it add [code] c.stop();[/code]
This fixes a teleport bug.
You can get it here:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha3a.rar
NEWS: Ventrillo has joined to help me
I am pleased to say that Ventrillo is now joining the project to help me, I asked him as I was impressed by his fishing code, and he accepted. Hopefully we should see some good updates by him soon! Thanks Ventrillo!
No update manager yet though, maybe tomorrow.
NEWS: ALPHA 2 RELEASED!
Alpha 2 contains all the goodness of alpha 1, but with NPC dialogue (thanks Jonas for the head animation!) and a walking bug fixed (thanks Fallen!).
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha2.rar
To set it up run the setup.bat file, which will compile it for the first time.
Then in the future use compile.bat to compile.
As usual, run.bat will run the server.
NEWS: ALPHA 1 RELEASED!
Alpha 1 has been released, and you don't need Eclipse! It comes with three batch files: compile.bat, run.bat and debug.bat. Compile.bat is obviosuly the compiler, and you need to set your PATH environment variable correctly (or put the JDK path inside the batch file), run.bat runs the server in production mode and debug.bat runs the server in debug mode. If you have problems with events you add, run the server in debug mode as it should print more exceptions out!
You can download it from http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha1.rar
This release includes everything in revision 38 (basically near-full woodcutting, near-full mining, better peformance using NIO, bones burying, packets/commands handled through hashmap, lots of refactoring!). Enjoy!
I hope to make more releases soon!
[u][b]Pictures[/b][/u]
[img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/combat.png[/img] [img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/rodfish.png[/img] [img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/greyrocks.png[/img] [img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/staticObjects.png[/img] [img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/fishing.png[/img] [img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/prayer-burybones.png[/img] [img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/woodcutting.png[/img] [img]http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/mining.png[/img]
[u][b]Videos[/b][/u]
Level up messages (and you can see the end of the still graphics, my timing was bad lol) - set to URL as I reached the 10 image limit:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...upmessages.png
NPC Dialogue video:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...npcactions.swf
NPC Dialogue video (old, view one above!)!:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/dialogue.swf
Woodcutting video (with stumps disappearing!):
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...ectManager.swf
And to prove it is not just for yourself, the same thing from a second viewpoint:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...ctManager2.swf
Fading interface video:
http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...ginterface.swf
[b]Credits (this may grow):
* Winterlove/Daiki for the base source * Blake for the rights and ban processor from RuneFusion 1.0.5 * Graham/Ventrillo for the majority of the Shard Revolutions code * The RS2DBase team for inspiration: o Varek/Stork o Jim o Angel o Impulser o Shamon king o The Linux o Graham o Goosey o Thiefmn o Samuraiblood2 o R E A P E R o Ian * Jonas for helping getting dialogues right. * Fallen for helping with a walking bug. * Epiphone for the amazing logos! * Ventrillo for helping getting the teleport still graphics working, and for the fishing skill code! * rsc for some more cool logos! * Fallen for helping with dialogues. * Jonas++ for helping with dialogues. * rsc for finding some bugs. * Dynamik and Luke132 for helping with the greyed out rock ids. * Jonas for the fletching skill! * rsc for the fading interface id and helping find that JDK 6u10 caused problems. * Optimum - npc spawn glitch. * HcoJustin - for pointing out some bugs. * stricken716 for the walk/run toggle fix. * yorick - trade bug.[/b]

item.title: Shard Revolutions - Winterlove base, High Performance , Great starting base
item.dc:creator: @Not_Pwnd Not Pwnd
item.description:
@Not_Pwnd wrote:

You guys should use this. It’ll really teach you a lot. It may be packaged but if you just read code and go through some trial and error you’ll figure it out fast. This server runs at the speed of light. I feel before I even click continue in the dialogue it moves ahead. It’s that fast. Just at least ATTEMPT at using it. This is one amazing server.

The person who posted this (Shard Revolutions) didn’t make it actually… Graham’s username on mopar is Graham (duh) so … yeah. Don’t give credits to the OP.

Read full topic

item.title: Shard Revolutions - Winterlove base, High Performance , Great starting base
item.dc:creator: @Shard_Revolutions Shard Revolutions
item.description:
@Shard_Revolutions wrote:

You will have issues if you use this with JDK 6 update 10. Please try with a more stable version instead, such as update 3 or update 7.

ALPHA 8 WITH TRADING RELEASED!

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/alpha8.rar

Enjoy!

If anyone knows the player 3/4 line dialogue sword hide/show packets, please contact me. I would like to know them, if you can find them for me, you will receive full credits! Thank you all!


Thanks epiphone and rsc for the logos! (it should automatically give you a random one)

This is a project that myself and Ventrillo are working on (Jonas++ has submitted quite a lot as well, and rsc designed the website). Btw, this is open source if you can’t figure out from the post.

NEWS: Alpha 7 released

Incldues a server GUI and many bugfixes.

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha7.rar

NEWS: Alpha 6c released

Alpha 6c includes some (more) crucial bugfixes related to the stability of the server, you should all upgrade.

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha6c.rar

NEWS: Alpha 6b released

Alpha 6b includes some crucial bugfixes related to the stability of the server, you should all upgrade.

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha6b.rar

NEWS: Alpha 6 released, includes shops and bonus code!

You can get it here:

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha6.rar

NEWS: Alpha 5 released, includes PVNPC melee combat!

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha5.rar

NEWS: Alpha 4 released

Alpha 4 is a bugfix release and includes fixes to many synchronization issues. You can download it here: http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha4.rar

NEWS: Alpha 3C released, with Jonas’s fletching!

Download at http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha3c.rar

NEWS: Alpha 3B released!

This includes numerous bug fixes and the mining rocks now become gray after being mined.

Download at http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha3b.rar

NEWS: Website created

The address is http://shardrev.grahamedgecombe.com/.

NEWS: Alpha 3A released!

This includes the long awaited object manager!, many bugfixes, dialogue improvements and woodcutting stumps (as a demo for the object manager)!

Quick teleport bugfix:

Inside Magic.java find

player.actionAssistant.startAnimation(-1);

Under it add

c.stop();

This fixes a teleport bug.

You can get it here:

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha3a.rar

NEWS: Ventrillo has joined to help me

I am pleased to say that Ventrillo is now joining the project to help me, I asked him as I was impressed by his fishing code, and he accepted. Hopefully we should see some good updates by him soon! Thanks Ventrillo!

No update manager yet though, maybe tomorrow.

NEWS: ALPHA 2 RELEASED!

Alpha 2 contains all the goodness of alpha 1, but with NPC dialogue (thanks Jonas for the head animation!) and a walking bug fixed (thanks Fallen!).

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha2.rar

To set it up run the setup.bat file, which will compile it for the first time.

Then in the future use compile.bat to compile.

As usual, run.bat will run the server.

NEWS: ALPHA 1 RELEASED!

Alpha 1 has been released, and you don’t need Eclipse! It comes with three batch files: compile.bat, run.bat and debug.bat. Compile.bat is obviosuly the compiler, and you need to set your PATH environment variable correctly (or put the JDK path inside the batch file), run.bat runs the server in production mode and debug.bat runs the server in debug mode. If you have problems with events you add, run the server in debug mode as it should print more exceptions out!

You can download it from http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/alpha1.rar

This release includes everything in revision 38 (basically near-full woodcutting, near-full mining, better peformance using NIO, bones burying, packets/commands handled through hashmap, lots of refactoring!). Enjoy!

I hope to make more releases soon!

Pictures








Videos

Level up messages (and you can see the end of the still graphics, my timing was bad lol) - set to URL as I reached the 10 image limit:

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...upmessages.png

NPC Dialogue video:

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...npcactions.swf

NPC Dialogue video (old, view one above!)!:

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/sr/dialogue.swf

Woodcutting video (with stumps disappearing!):

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...ectManager.swf

And to prove it is not just for yourself, the same thing from a second viewpoint:

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...ctManager2.swf

Fading interface video:

http://www.grahamedgecombe.com/tmp/s...ginterface.swf

[b]Credits (this may grow):

* Winterlove/Daiki for the base source
* Blake for the rights and ban processor from RuneFusion 1.0.5
* Graham/Ventrillo for the majority of the Shard Revolutions code
* The RS2DBase team for inspiration:
      o Varek/Stork
      o Jim
      o Angel
      o Impulser
      o Shamon king
      o The Linux
      o Graham
      o Goosey
      o Thiefmn
      o Samuraiblood2
      o R E A P E R
      o Ian
* Jonas for helping getting dialogues right.
* Fallen for helping with a walking bug.
* Epiphone for the amazing logos!
* Ventrillo for helping getting the teleport still graphics working, and for the fishing skill code!
* rsc for some more cool logos!
* Fallen for helping with dialogues.
* Jonas++ for helping with dialogues.
* rsc for finding some bugs.
* Dynamik and Luke132 for helping with the greyed out rock ids.
* Jonas for the fletching skill!
* rsc for the fading interface id and helping find that JDK 6u10 caused problems.
* Optimum - npc spawn glitch.
* HcoJustin - for pointing out some bugs.
* stricken716 for the walk/run toggle fix.
* yorick - trade bug.[/b]
